ygData.subject: Re: RE: Another Question
ygData.msgSnippet: As I previously said, my stun spells capped out a LONG time ago, not just at reaching level 50, tho they and my dd spells did notch up a bit as I gained levels
ygData.messageBody:
As I previously said, my stun spells capped out a LONG time ago, not just at
reaching level 50, tho they and my dd spells did notch up a bit as I gained
levels after first acquiring them. But again, it has nothing to do with how
much wisdom you have. To my knowledge, the only thing determined by wisdom
is the amount of mana you have to cast. Would be interested to know if
anyone knows of any other attibute wisdom has?

Mik
----- Original Message -----
From: <srutkowski@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, December 21, 1999 11:40 AM
Subject: [EQ-Clerics] RE: Another Question


> From: srutkowski@...
>
>
>
> Drizben hit it right on the head, even if he is a dark elf :)
>
> Most of our HP/AC buffs and DD spells go do up a couple points each level
until
> a certain level, after which they remain at the same point level. Words
of
> Force (220 dam) and Banish Undead (585 dam) being the only two spells that
I can
> think of that remain the same once you get them, level 49 and level 44
> respectively (possible Shield of Words- 31 AC, level 49).
>
> Of course, all spells eventually stop increasing at level 50.........
>
> <grin>
>
> Ailamil Faithbringer
> Tunare's not-so-humble Servant
>
>
> Drizben wrote:
>
> Example: Wrath does 198 points at 29th, 200 at 30, 202 at 31 and 204 at
32.
> I just made 33 last night and haven't cast it yet so I am assuming it will
> either go to 206 or stay at 204.
>
> Also, it's not only our DD spells, if you check your buffs they go up by a
> point or 2 per level as well. Bravery gave me 122hp last level, now it
gives
> 123.
>
>
